WorkItem.Description:
NCalc has a bunch of Console.WriteLine's that can impact performance.
Convert Console.WriteLine to Debug.Print, or add #if DEBUG conditionals.

Or possibly remove the console prints all together and replace it with a status variable.

A few Examples:
A first chance exception of type 'NCalc.EvaluationException' occurred in NCalc.dll
Parse Filter String Exception: no viable alternative at input '<EOF>' at line 0:-1
XXX.vshost.exe Information: 0 : Expression retrieved from cache:
XXX..vshost.exe Information: 0 : Expression added to cache:

Comments.Message: Ideally, there'd be either a Programmatic Switch (ie TraceSource and SourceSwitch) or a specific preprocessor conditional. I don't want to have to turn off all my debugging just to not see debug information from NCalc.
